summary: The Brooklyn Bridge in New York City connects Manhattan and Brooklyn, spanning the East River. Opened in 1883, it was the world's longest suspension bridge at the time. Designed by John A. Roebling, its construction took 13 years due to controversies and design complexities. The bridge has undergone several renovations and now allows cars, pedestrians, and cyclists. It's a famous tourist attraction and a symbol of New York City, listed as a National Historic Landmark.
title: Brooklyn Bridge
